overview: CEO of Koru. 1st website featured in a major children’s magazine at age 12. Selected for the Startup Chile program. Ran Canada’s largest business plan competition and founded launchpad program for Canada’s top young entrepreneurs (Founder2Founder). Started own DJ business and DJ’d for Red Bull and 1 of the top 10 black tie events in N.A. Came 2nd in an MBA business plan competition in Brazil (as an undergrad) and was featured in the NY Times. Led the marketing of the biggest launch at P&G in 27 years (Tide Pods), managing a $10MM budget. Learned design through 2 years at university’s design agency, and shadow experiences at Kiva, Causes, Launchrock, Dojo, and the Stanford d.school. Finalist in competition to shadow Dave McClure. Spoke on stage with Peter Thiel. Member of exclusive MaiTai kiteboarding group run by Charles River Ventures. Blogs for Techvibes & Women 2.0, co-wrote article with Canada’s top marketing professor (Canadian Marketing Hall of Fame). Bachelor of Commerce, Queen’s University.
